html:
In Morm. 4:5 we read, "But, behold, the judgments of God will overtake the wicked; and it is by the wicked that the wicked are punished." The Book of Mormon renders the ending of verse 5 "and the staff in their hand is their indignation" (rather than the KJV "mine indignation").

O Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, and the staff in their hand is mine indignation. (Isaiah 10:5.) O Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, and the staff in their hand is their indignation. (2 Nephi

20:5.)

Thus Assyria is a good example of the principle taught in Morm. 4:5. Assyria will punish the wicked nations of Syria and Ephraim in her own wicked indignation. In verse 12 we read that the heart of the king of Assyria is not right.
